Max Pagan

Mini-Project 3

Using Markdown, I’ll create the appropriate relational algebra statements based on the DB schema.

  1. How many copies of the book titled The Lost Tribe are owned by the library branch whose name is ‘Sharpstown’? \[\pi_{\text{Book_Copies.No_of_copies}}\left(\sigma_{\text{Book.Title} = \text{'The Lost Tribe'} AND \text{Library_branch.Branch_name} = \text{'Sharpstown'}}(\text{Book} \bowtie \text{Book_Copies} \bowtie \text{Library_branch})\right)\]

  2. How many copies of the book titled The Lost Tribe are owned by each library branch? \[\pi_{\text{Library_branch.Branch_name, Book_Copies.No_of_copies}}\left(\sigma_{\text{Book.Title} = \text{'The Lost Tribe'}}(\text{Book} \bowtie \text{Book_Copies} \bowtie \text{Library_branch})\right)\]

  3. Retrieve the names of all borrowers who do not have any books checked out. \[\pi_{\text{Borrower.Name}}(\text{Borrower} - \pi_{\text{Borrower.Name}}(\text{Borrower} \bowtie \text{Book_Loans}))\]

  4. For each book that is loaned out from the Sharpstown branch and whose Due_date is today, retrieve the book title, the borrower’s name, and the borrower’s address. \[\pi_{\text{Book.Title, Borrower.Name, Borrower.Address}}\left(\sigma_{\text{Library_branch.Branch_name} = \text{'Sharpstown'} AND \text{Book_Loans.Due_date} = \text{2024-01-25}}(\text{Book} \bowtie \text{Book_Loans} \bowtie \text{Borrower} \bowtie \text{Library_branch})\right)\]

  5. For each library branch, retrieve the branch name and the total number of books loaned out from that branch. \[\pi_{\text{Library_branch.Branch_name, COUNT(Book_Loans.Book_id)}}(\text{Library_branch} \bowtie \text{Book_Loans})\]

  6. Retrieve the names, addresses, and number of books checked out for all borrowers who have more than five books checked out. \[\pi_{\text{Borrower.Name, Borrower.Address, COUNT(Book_Loans.Book_id)}}\left(\sigma_{\text{COUNT(Book_Loans.Book_id)} > 5}(\text{Borrower} \bowtie \text{Book_Loans})\right)\]

  7. Retrieve a list of Book ID and Book Title that are borrowed by all borrowers. \[\pi_{\text{Book_Loans.Book_id, Book_Loans.Title}}(\text{Book_Loans}))\]

I interpreted g as a complete list of book IDs and Titles of all checked out books. I didn’t use a join, because I figured if the book_id was in book_loans, it was being borrowed. Did I interpret this correctly?
